See all in one page

Welcome

  • This lesson is mostly an introduction to UoB VR Systems for 2023/2024 Ci606 module.

Lecturer and expertise

  • I’ll deliver this module focusing on my experience in the domain of computer graphics, their application to sectors such as Cultural Heritage
  • I’ll also drawing on projects, experiences and tools which myself and my team has developed/has access to.

Extended Reality (XR) Systems

  • Virtual Reality Systems draw on knowledge and skills relevant to computer graphics.
  • This is a well established domain in computer science.
  • The development of systems in this domain draw on common practices of software engineering.

Skills and knowledge

  • You will gain knowledge which is specific to computer graphics.
  • This knowledge and skills is transferable in terms of developing systems which use multi-dimensional media and uses various visualisation and interaction hardware.
  • You will have freedom during the module to explore applications that are of your interest.

Computer graphics

  • Computer graphics is a well established domain.
  • Look at the list of resources in this section to get an insight into the latest developments in this area.

Intended Learning Objectives (ILO)

  • You will need to demonstrate three key skills when we assess the module.
  • This section introduces you to the ILO for the module.

Assumptions

  • For this module you will need a good level of understanding of software development, programming in object oriented language, data structures and medium-level of maths- mostly geometry.

Module Structure

  • The module is delivered in 12 sessions of 4 hours.
  • These sessions are broken down in 2 for theory, and 2 for practice.
  • In total you will be expected to spend from 6-8 hours a week.

Resources

  • Resources, including reading material, software and equipment are available if you wish to use it.
  • You can also use your own development environment if you wish to learn a specific one.

Other News

  • Various activities are available in parallel to the module should you wish to get further involved.

Tutorial: Research on Extended Reality Systems

  • This tutorial involves researching what is available in the lab and in the market.

This lesson is subject to the Code of Conduct
